title: Prioritizing land to avoid species loss could reduce species extinction risk twice as efficiently
description: Amid an alarming surge in global habitat destruction and species extinction, new research by an international team of scientists proposes a new global approach to choosing protected lands that could reduce species extinction risk twice as efficiently as current methods.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Porous platinum matrix shows promise as a new actuator material
description: Actuators are common machine components that convert energy into movement, like the muscles in the human body, vibrators in mobile phones or electric motors. Ideal actuator materials need good electrochemical properties to repeatedly conduct electrical currents made of flowing electrons.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: In the fight against malaria-carrying mosquitoes, just add soap
description: Could the solution to the decades-long battle against malaria be as simple as soap? In a new study published in PLOS Neglected Tropical Diseases, scientists at The University of Texas at El Paso have made a compelling case for it.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: New research suggests plants might be able to absorb more CO2 from human activities than previously expected
description: New research published in Science Advances paints an uncharacteristically upbeat picture for the planet. This is because more realistic ecological modeling suggests the world's plants may be able to take up more atmospheric CO2 from human activities than previously predicted.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Deep dive on sea level rise: New modeling gives better predictions on Antarctic ice sheet melt
description: Using historical records from around Australia, an international team of researchers have put forward the most accurate prediction to date of past Antarctic ice sheet melt, providing a more realistic forecast of future sea level rise.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: New study shows in real-time what helps mammals survive a natural disaster
description: When Cyclone Idai swept through Mozambique's Gorongosa National Park in May 2019, one of nature's deadliest forces encountered one of the most technologically sophisticated wildlife parks on the planet. Princeton researchers and colleagues from around the world documented the effects using trail cameras and animal-tracking devices that had been in use before the storm.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Deep within the Earth, iron oxide withstands extreme temperatures and pressures
description: The core–mantle boundary (CMB) is the interface between the Earth's iron metal core and the thick rocky layer of mantle just above the core. It is a world of extremes—temperatures thousands of degrees Fahrenheit and pressures over a million times the pressure at the surface of the Earth. While it may seem far away from our environment on Earth's surface, plumes of material from the CMB can ascend upwards through the planet over tens of millions of years, influencing the chemistry, geologic structure, and plate tectonics of the surface world where we live.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Previously unknown luminescence revealed in ten deep sea species and an order of sea cucumbers
description: In a new textbook published November 10, 2023, "The World of Sea Cucumbers," a team of researchers, including Nagoya University professor Manabu Bessho-Uehara, takes us deep into the watery world of sea cucumbers and reveals their ability to emit light.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Crime-free housing policies increase evictions among minorities, but do not cut crime
description: Policies that encourage landlords to evict tenants who have involvement with the criminal justice system do not appear to reduce crime, while increasing evictions among Black residents and people with lower incomes, according to a new RAND Corporation report.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: PhD student bioengineers potato plant to detect gamma radiation
description: A researcher at the University of Tennessee Herbert College of Agriculture has developed a potato plant that can detect gamma radiation, providing reliable indications of harmful radiation levels without complex monitoring technologies.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Study reveals wintertime formation of large pollution particles in China's skies
description: School of Earth and Atmospheric Sciences researchers find dangerous sulfates are formed, and their particles get bigger, within the plumes of pollution belching from coal-fired power plants
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Researchers develop new method to help with analysis of single cell data
description: CITE-seq (cellular indexing of transcriptomes and epitopes) is an RNA sequencing-based method that simultaneously quantifies cell surface protein and transcriptomic data within a single cell readout. The ability to study cells concurrently offers unprecedented insights into new cell types, disease states or other conditions.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: A cost-efficient and transparent method to measure carbon dioxide emission estimates using GOSAT
description: Researchers in Japan and Mongolia have carried out the world's first instance of incorporating satellite-based CO2 emission estimates into a GHG emission report as the verification on the Second Biennial Update Report (BUR2) of Mongolia submitted to the UNFCCC on 15 November 2023, resulting in high accuracy match with actual reported values, reports a new study published online in Scientific Reports in 2023.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: 2023 Canadian wildfires impacted air quality as far away as Europe and China, study finds
description: Numerical air quality models have described the extent of severe negative impacts on air quality resulting from the record 2023 Canadian wildfires, demonstrating that almost the whole of the Northern Hemisphere, not just Canada and the northern United States, were affected.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: What causes political corruption? Experts explain
description: A wave of political corruption scandals has rocked institutions across America.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Study reveals the power of reflecting upon legacy
description: Prompting people to consider how their lives will impact future generations leads them to give more to charity and less to family members, according to new University at Buffalo School of Management research.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: New study debunks myth that feminists hate men
description: Feminists are not "man haters," a comprehensive new study reveals. Researchers find feminists and non-feminists display no difference in attitude towards men, debunking the common myth that the feminists dislike men.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Hubble images NGC 941, a spiral galaxy with an explosive past
description: This image from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope features the spiral galaxy NGC 941, which lies about 55 million light-years from Earth. Hubble's Advanced Camera for Surveys (ACS) collected the data that created this image. Beautiful NGC 941 is undoubtedly the main attraction in this view; however, the hazy-looking galaxy was not the motivation for collecting the data. That distinction belongs to an astronomical event that took place in the galaxy years before: the supernova SN 2005ad.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Study of adolescents' perspectives on commercial profiling, privacy
description: Researchers at the Department of Social Sciences and Philosophy at the University of Jyväskylä have explored adolescents' awareness of being commercially profiled online and their perspectives on online targeted advertisements. The data for the study consisted of eight focus group discussions (N = 38) conducted between December 2020 and May 2021 with adolescents aged 13 to 16 years in schools across Finland's capital region. The findings are published in the Journal of Children and Media.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Use of urine in fertilizer can contribute to increased food security
description: The production of mineral based fertilizers requires a significant amount of energy and relies in part on non-renewable resources such as phosphate rock. Furthermore, the price of mineral fertilizer is currently at a record high due to surging input costs and supply disruptions caused by sanctions and export restrictions.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Report: Climate change is threatening health globally
description: The effects of climate change are killing people and negatively affecting the health of more and more people in the world. The growing health threats could worsen if we do not urgently address climate change. Even at a global warming of 1.14 degrees, human losses are increasing rapidly, states the eighth global report from The Lancet Countdown on Health and Climate Change.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Australian report finds COVID-19 worsened migrants and refugees' access to justice services
description: The COVID-19 pandemic exacerbated and magnified migrant and refugee communities' difficulties in accessing social and legal services in Victoria, a new report has found.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Unveiling Mercury's geological mysteries: Salt glaciers, primordial atmosphere, and the new frontiers of astrobiology
description: Scientists from the Planetary Science Institute have uncovered evidence of potential salt glaciers on Mercury, opening a new frontier in astrobiology by revealing a volatile environment that might echo habitability conditions found in Earth's extreme locales.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Bridging gaps in the European plant-based protein value chain
description: The journey toward a transformed European food system through the development of new plant-based value chains faces numerous challenges, as highlighted by researchers and industry experts from Ireland, Germany, Italy, and Serbia.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Enhancing the antimicrobial activity of silver nanoparticles against pathogens by using tea extracts
description: Researchers at the Institute of Physical Chemistry of the Polish Academy of Sciences (IPC PAS) have demonstrated that green tea–silver nanoparticles as a powerful tool against pathogens such as bacteria and yeast. Their work is published in Nanoscale Advances.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Q&A: Professor discusses new approaches for the implementation of the quantum internet
description: Researchers around the world are working on a network which could connect quantum computers with one another over long distances. Andreas Reiserer, Professor of Quantum Networks at the Technical University of Munich (TUM), explains the challenges which have to be mastered and how atoms captured in crystals can help.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: NASA's Deep Space Optical Comm demo sends, receives first data
description: DSOC, an experiment that could transform how spacecraft communicate, has achieved "first light," sending data via laser to and from far beyond the moon for the first time.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Navigation on the Mississippi has worsened for decades, finds study
description: Shifting water levels have driven a significant decline in navigation conditions in recent decades along the Mississippi River, a primary engine of commerce in the United States, research from the federal government and Princeton University shows.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Life might be easiest to find on planets that match an earlier Earth
description: We're inching closer and closer to reliably detecting biosignatures on distant planets. Much of the focus is on determining which chemicals indicate life's presence.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: The echoes from inflation could still be shaking the cosmos today
description: In the very early universe, physics were weird. A process known as inflation, during which the universe went from a single infinitesimal point to everything we see today, was one such instance of those weird physics. Now, scientists from the Chinese Academy of Science have sifted through 15 years of pulsar timing data in order to put some constraints on what physics looks like.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Desert fire simulation helps with education and engagement
description: A new simulation game is helping Indigenous rangers, landowners, children and more to learn about fire behavior and how they can mitigate the increasing threat of infernos.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Q&A: Co-creation can serve as the catalyst for the most innovative outcomes. Here's how
description: Ever heard the tales of companies convinced they had a groundbreaking product, only to "forget" to check with the end user if there's even a demand for it? Many businesses get stuck in a linear thought process, thinking they are the experts and missing out on the potential of engaging end users and other stakeholders.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: New survey shows opinions differ on causes, effects of extreme weather
description: Ask a cross section of Texans, and about half are likely to say there is a link between climate change and severe weather events, suggests the newest report in the Texas Trends 2023 survey series.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Community-driven analysis identifies strategies to improve equity in Los Angeles' clean energy transition
description: After two years of robust modeling and gathering input from over 100 community members, 14 community-based organizations, and 31 additional stakeholder organizations in Los Angeles, the U.S. Department of Energy's National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) has synthesized its findings into equitable clean energy transition strategies for the city.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Unique weather phenomenon may have helped Ukraine identify and sink Russian ship Moskva
description: A pair of radar experts at Swedish Defense Research working with a meteorologist from the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute has found evidence suggesting that the reason the Ukrainian military was able to spot and sink a distant Russian missile cruiser during the early part of the Ukraine war was due to a unique weather phenomenon.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Q&A: How chronic wasting disease threatens deer populations
description: With the firearm deer hunting season kicking off, many Michigan hunters have their minds set to bring home a winning whitetail. But for Sonja Christensen, an assistant professor in the Department of Fisheries and Wildlife in Michigan State University's College of Agriculture and Natural Resources, the focus—now and all year long—is on protecting deer from disease.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Study highlights need for enhanced tropical cyclone identification and simulation in climate models
description: Tropical cyclones in the western North Pacific (WNP) stand as formidable natural forces, wreaking havoc on Earth and posing significant challenges to disaster preparedness. As we grapple with the uncertainties of future projections for WNP tropical cyclone activities, a recent study published in Environmental Research Letters sheds light on the crucial need to enhance identification and simulation techniques in climate models.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: North Atlantic circulation found to have reduced historical changes in climate
description: Heat transferring from the surface to the deep ocean in the North Atlantic helped reduce climate swings during the last 1,000 years, according to a newly published paper led by researchers from the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) and UCL.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Q&A: Report explores the challenge of ending food waste and food insecurity in Australia
description: Australia produces more than enough food to feed our population. Yet a third of all the food we produce is currently ending up in the dump, and food insecurity is on the rise.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: A highly efficient open-shell singlet luminescent diradical with strong magnetoluminescence properties
description: Open-shell singlet (OS) diradicals are important building blocks for functional molecular materials, with a large number of pioneering works by researchers advancing their development and applications across various fields. Despite this progress, there remains a lack of research regarding luminescent OS diradicals, hindering their potential use in optoelectronic applications. In fact, the luminescent diradicals are rare chemical species, there are only a few reports to date.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: When raises backfire: Research examines pitfalls of performance-based pay
description: When it comes to retaining and motivating employees, raises may seem like a sure bet.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Pioneering robot arm poised to reach new heights in quantum
description: Scientists carrying out quantum research will be able to do so faster and more adaptably, thanks to a new robotic arm which could hold the key to major breakthroughs.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Urban planning has long ignored women's experiences: Five ways we can make our cities safer
description: Women consistently raise concerns about their safety when moving through their cities and communities.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Big data play a huge role in US presidential elections. Do they have the same impact in Australia?
description: A key reason Barack Obama won the 2012 U.S. presidential election was his campaign's use of "big data" to target specific voters. His team created multiple versions of ads aimed at niche audiences, taking care to test every message.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Putting an end to plastic separation anxiety
description: Bio-based plastics such as polylactic acid (PLA) were invented to help solve the plastic waste crisis, but they often end up making waste management more challenging.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: What does it mean to be asexual?
description: In recent years, we've seen a burgeoning social movement for the acceptance of asexuality. We've also seen more asexual characters popping up in shows such as Heartstopper and Sex Education.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Let coastlines be coastlines: How nature-based approaches can protect Canada's coasts
description: Along Canadian coasts, storm surges and flooding have gone from breaking news to seasonal norms.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Viewpoint: Five things we need to see in Australia's new nature laws
description: Australia's abysmal rates of extinctions and land clearing since European colonization are infamous globally. Our national environmental legislation has largely failed to protect biodiversity, including many threatened plants, animals and ecological communities. But change is afoot.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: 'I feel like I've been able to create more awareness': What is it like for Indigenous men at top-ranked universities?
description: One of the top priorities of the Universities Accord process it to improve access to university in Australia, particularly for those from underrepresented groups.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Deep learning model can detect a previously unknown quasicrystalline phase
description: Crystalline materials are made up of atoms, ions, or molecules arranged in an ordered, three-dimensional structure. They are widely used for the development of semiconductors, pharmaceuticals, photovoltaics, and catalysts.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Most Americans are oblivious to 'forever chemicals' and risks, research finds
description: Texas A&M AgriLife scientists conducting the first generalized U.S. study on public awareness of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances, or PFAS, found most Americans do not know what the substances are or have knowledge of any potential associated risks.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Novel approaches for correcting gene expression insufficiency
description: A new molecular technology capable of binding to mRNA and regulating gene expression may offer a new avenue for treating diseases caused by haploinsufficiency, or the absence of one functional gene copy, according to a study published in Nature Communications.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: How could global food production break down?
description: Industrialized farming relies heavily on outside inputs, like synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, machinery, seeds, and animal feed. A  study published in Nature Food predicts how much yield would be lost from "input shocks" that disrupt these supplies.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: No evidence for widespread transmission of viruses by African bats, says study
description: The scientific community and the public alike have often been presented with portrayals of bats as carriers of numerous dangerous viruses that are passed onto humans. In a paper published in Biology Letters, an international team of biologists, virologists and conservationists challenge this narrative surrounding bats.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Climate change and its negative affect on aquatic biodiversity: Making global targets local for freshwater protection
description: Rebecca Flitcroft, a research fish biologist with the USDA Forest Service Pacific Northwest Research Station, wants to shine a light on the need for freshwater protection because biodiversity in freshwater is declining at an alarming rate. To address this critical issue, Flitcroft and her colleagues were recently published in Nature Sustainability with their article, "Making Global Targets Local for Freshwater Protection."
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: When growth becomes a weakness for cancer cells
description: ETH researchers are shedding light on what can happen when cells exceed their normal size and become senescent. The new findings could help to optimize cancer therapies.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Green growth loses weight as a consensus position in the European Parliament, finds study
description: Politicians in the European Parliament are supportive of post-growth and ecosocialist positions to tackle the climate crisis, and not only green growth.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Expert calls for stronger standards for courts weighing scientific evidence, expertise
description: Jennifer L. Mnookin, chancellor of the University of Wisconsin–Madison and one of the most cited evidence law scholars in the nation, this week authored an editorial in the journal Science calling for a national commission of leading judges, scientists, legal academics and forensic practitioners to develop a framework ensuring forensic science that is admitted in courtrooms is valid and reliable.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Study of WE0913A moon impactor shows it was a Chinese booster rocket with an unknown object attached
description: A team of aerospace and mechanical engineers from the University of Arizona, California Institute of Technology, Project Pluto and the Planetary Science Institute has found evidence strongly suggesting that the March 4, 2022, WE0913A moon impactor was a Chinese booster rocket with an unknown object attached to its side.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Scientists craft a protein-based bandpass filter for synthetic biology
description: EPFL scientists have crafted a biological system that mimics an electronic bandpass filter, a novel sensor that could revolutionize self-regulated biological mechanisms in synthetic biology.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Scientists claim to have solved the damselfly color mystery
description: For more than 20 years, a research team at Lund University in Sweden has studied the common bluetail damselfly. Females occur in three different color forms—one with a male-like appearance, something that protects them from mating harassment. In a new study, an international research team found that this genetic color variation that is shared among several species arose through changes in a specific genomic region at least 5 million years ago.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Shedding light on unique conduction mechanisms in a new type of perovskite oxide
description: The remarkable proton and oxide-ion (dual-ion) conductivities of hexagonal perovskite-related oxide Ba7Nb3.8Mo1.2O20.1 are promising for next-generation electrochemical devices, as reported by scientists at Tokyo Tech. The unique ion-transport mechanisms they unveiled will hopefully pave the way for better dual-ion conductors, which could play an essential role in tomorrow's clean energy technologies.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: SpaceX 'Starship' launch postponed until Saturday
description: SpaceX has pushed back by one day the long awaited second launch of its next-generation Starship rocket because of technical issues, the company's CEO Elon Musk said Thursday.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: Moderate earthquake shakes eastern Myanmar and is felt in northern Thailand
description: A moderate earthquake shook eastern Myanmar on Friday morning.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: California scientists seek higher pay in 3-day strike drawing thousands of picketers
description: More than 1,000 state scientists in California took to the picket line Thursday on day two of a three-day strike, calling for higher wages for work they say often goes unrecognized in a state that sets environmental policy trends on the national and global stage.
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories

title: 'Fishing' chimpanzees found to enjoy termites as a seasonal treat
description: The discovery that chimpanzees use tools to fish for termites revolutionized our understanding of their abilities—but we still don't have crucial context to help us understand termite fishing and chimpanzee minds. Are chimpanzees fishing for a seasonal treat or trying their luck?
artist: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
album: Phys.org - latest science and technology news stories
